audiences.rationale: Defines repo intent and how to configure shared workspaces (docs/work/output) so process owners can establish guardrails.
Offers quickstart steps for attaching AI assistants and tuning agents, matching power users seeking predictable behavior.
Outlines structural expectations (bootstrap order, directories) that automation agents must honor to stay aligned.

potential_misses.rationale: Lacks success metrics or executive summary that managers typically expect before approving workflows.
Does not translate concepts into non-technical explanations or instructional framing.

audiences.rationale: Defines the layered governance stack, directives, and validation rituals that framework maintainers steward.
Specifies runtime behavior, tone, commands, and safety markers that automation agents must follow at startup.
Explains instruction hierarchy, sandboxing, and command practices relevant to tailoring operational processes.

potential_misses.rationale: Dense governance depth with few practical examples may be difficult for solo power users to apply.
Lacks high-level KPIs or rollout summaries managers rely on for oversight.

audiences.rationale: Captures the problem statement, scope, and desired outcomes needed to design workflows.
Highlights business outcomes (token efficiency, maintainability) tied to managerial approval.
Frames how agents collaborate and what success looks like, informing enablement plans.

potential_misses.rationale: Does not break vision goals into actionable engineering tasks or architecture diagrams.
Remains purely strategic and omits operational instructions automation agents rely on.
